smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams found. All 19 pages contain at least one element. Each diagram (package diagram on page 1, use case diagrams on pages 2-3, activity diagram on page 4, class diagrams on pages 5-13, database diagrams on pages 14-19) has visible elements.

All use case ovals in use case diagrams (pages 2-3) are associated with at least one actor. Page 2: 'Tuvasta kasutaja' connected to 'Süsteem'; 'Aktiivsed autod', 'Vaata kõiki autosid', 'Vaata autode koondaruannet' connected to actors Uudistaja, Klienditeenindaja, Juhataja, Klient, Autode haldur. Page 3: All use cases connected to Autode haldur and/or Juhataja.

No duplicate use case names describing the same activity with the same actor. All use cases have distinct names: page 2 has 'Tuvasta kasutaja', 'Aktiivsed autod', 'Vaata kõiki autosid', 'Vaata autode koondaruannet'; page 3 has 'Registreeri auto', 'Lõpeta auto', 'Muuda autot', 'Aktiveeri auto', 'Muuda auto mittaktiivseks', 'Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid autosid', 'Unusta auto'. None represent the same activity.

Package diagram on page 1 shows distinct element names within each package. Autode funktsionaalne allsüsteem, Isikute register, Klassifikaatorite register, Töötajate register, Autode register, and Klientide register all contain uniquely named elements within their boundaries.

No redundant data columns without FK relationships found. Common columns like 'nimetus' and 'on_aktiivne' appear in multiple classifier tables (pages 14-19) but represent different contextual data (e.g., country name vs. category name) - not copies of the same data value. All shared data relationships are connected via explicit FK constraints.

Inconsistent naming form detected on page 2. The use case 'Aktiivsed autod' (Active cars) starts with an adjective/noun, while all other use cases start with verbs: 'Tuvasta kasutaja', 'Vaata kõiki autosid', 'Vaata autode koondaruannet' (page 2); 'Registreeri auto', 'Lõpeta auto', 'Muuda autot', 'Aktiveeri auto', etc. (page 3). This is a mixed naming pattern (noun-first vs. verb-first).

State diagram 'Auto seisundidiagramm' on page 9 has all states reachable. States: Algus (initial), Ootel (from Algus), Aktiivne (from Ootel or Mitteaktiivne), Mitteaktiivne (from Aktiivne), Lõpetatud (from Aktiivne or Mitteaktiivne), Unustatud (from Ootel). Every state has at least one incoming transition path.

Activity diagram 'Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm' on page 4 has all actions reachable from the start node. Actions: 'Vaata kõiki autosid, mida saab lõpetada' (from Algus), 'Otsi autot' (via decision from previous), 'Vali auto' (via decisions), 'Lõpeta valitud auto' (from Vali auto). All actions have incoming flows from the start node.

All relationships in class diagrams (pages 5-13) and database diagrams (pages 14-19) have multiplicity indicators on both ends. Examples: page 5 shows '0..1' and '0..*' for mentor relationship, '1' and '0..*' for registreerija; page 14 shows '1' and '0..1' for Isik-Kasutajakonto, '1' and '0..*' for FK relationships.

No diagram has ≥10 central elements. Counts per page: Page 2: 4 use cases; Page 3: 7 use cases; Page 5: 3 classes; Page 6: 6 classes; Page 7: 6 classes; Page 8: 6 classes; Page 9: 6 states; Page 10: 5 classes; Page 11: 3 classes; Page 12: 7 classes; Page 13: 3 classes; Page 14: 4 tables; Page 15: 9 tables (Tootaja_roll, Isiku_seisundi_liik, Auto_kategooria_tyyp, Riik, Tootaja_seisundi_liik, Auto_kytuse_liik, Kliendi_seisundi_liik, Auto_mark, Auto_kategooria); Page 16: 3 tables; Page 17: 6 tables; Page 18: 2 tables; Page 19: 5 tables. Maximum is 9 on page 15. Threshold is ≥10. Since 9 < 10, smell is NOT present.

No element has ≥6 visual connection lines on any single diagram page. Maximum connections counted: Page 14 (Isik): 3 lines; Page 15 (Auto_kategooria): 1 line; Page 17 (Auto): 4 lines to Auto_kategooria_omamine, Auto_kytuse_liik, Auto_seisundi_liik, Auto_mark; Page 19 (Tootaja): 4 lines. Maximum is 4. Threshold is ≥6. Since 4 < 6, smell is NOT present.

Visual inspection of all diagrams shows no relationships with distances more than twice the average distance between elements. Elements are reasonably positioned within their diagrams with no extreme spatial separations.

Use case 'Aktiivsed autod' on page 2 does not start with an active verb. 'Aktiivsed' means 'Active' (adjective), making this a noun phrase (Active cars) rather than a verb-initiated action. Other use cases correctly start with verbs: 'Tuvasta' (Identify), 'Vaata' (View), 'Registreeri' (Register), 'Lõpeta' (Terminate), 'Muuda' (Change), 'Aktiveeri' (Activate), 'Unusta' (Forget).

No class, table, attribute, or use case name has ≤3 characters. All names have ≥4 characters. Examples: 'Isik' (4), 'Auto' (4), 'Riik' (4), 'Klient' (6), 'nimetus' (7), 'isik_id' (7). Threshold is ≤3 characters. No names meet this threshold.

All class names start with uppercase and are singular. Classes: Isik, Töötaja, Auto, Kasutajakonto, Klient, Klassifikaator, Auto_kategooria, Auto_mark, Riik, etc. (pages 5-13). No lowercase-starting or plural class names found.

All attribute/column names start with lowercase. Examples from database diagrams (pages 14-19): isik_id, isikukood, e_meil, nimetus, on_aktiivne, kirjeldus, auto_kood, mudel, reg_number, vin_kood. No uppercase-starting attribute names found.

All database table names are singular. Tables (pages 14-19): Isik, Kasutajakonto, Tootaja_roll, Auto_kategooria, Riik, Tootaja, Klient, Auto, Auto_kategooria_omamine, Tootaja_rolli_omamine, Auto_kytuse_liik, Auto_seisundi_liik, Auto_mark, Isiku_seisundi_liik, Tootaja_seisundi_liik, Kliendi_seisundi_liik. No plural table names found.

No type prefixes found on class, table, or attribute names. Prefixes PK_, FK_, pfK, IXFK_ are allowed per rules and used only for keys/indexes. No disallowed prefixes like tbl_, uc_, str, int found. Table names: Isik, Auto, Klient (no tbl_ prefix). Attributes: nimetus, isikukood, e_meil (no type prefixes).
